text: UPDATED: FEB 24, 2017 341mL Bottle: Hazy brown amber, minimal to no white head that dissipated. Aroma of dried fruits, caramel, bread, toast. Lots of sweet, slightly warming alcohol and a bit of bitterness. Medium body and carb, thin oily feel, and very nice nutty toffee slightly dry finish.

341ml bottle. Cloudy, chestnut colour with small, thick, creamy, fairly lasting, superbly lacing, beige head. Sweet-ish, nuttily malty aroma, toffee notes, some caramel, a touch of raisin, rum and mocha. Taste is nuttily malty, slightly sweet, minimally dry woody, hints of toffee, raisin, dried fruit in general; slightly papery overall.

Bottle share at Cotteridge II as LAlchimiste Eisbock. Many thanks to Cotteridge. Dark orange brown, still, small foamy off-white head. Aroma is malt-forward, sweet toffee, raisin. Body is light, smooth, soft carbonation. Taste is toffee, sweet, light tangy marmite dimension, dry boozy finish. (3.4)

Bue en bouteille de 355ml. Nez sur lalcool, le pruneau, les fruits noirs. Palais alcool, sucre, prunes. Grosse corpulence, et grande longueur en bouche. Pas trop mon style en fait, lalcool est vraiment trop présent.

Bottle split at Cotts Convention ii, thanks to team Cotts, 05/03/16.
Rich amber with a decent off white head.
Nose is nutty, dark fruit, Xmas cake, earthy.
Taste comprises dark fruit rinds, dates, light spice, fruit loaf.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, warming alcohol in the close.
Ok but lacks any finesse.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Bue en bouteille de 35.5cl à la Pizz à Devecey.
Couleur marron avec reflet cuivre, peu de mousse et peu deffervescence
Nez prune
En bouche très ronde avec une pointe de sucre candi et de prune et de pruneau
Bottle. Cotteridge Beano v2. Amber. Thin head. Sweet. Boozy. Fruit and nuts. Got some tart apple. Ok. Bittersweet thing going on.

Bottle thanks to the Cotteridge Guys at the 2016 Cotteridge Convention. It pours clear dark amber with a small white head. The aroma is bitter - sweet, malt-driven, umami, toasted malt, sticky, brown bread and malt loaf. The taste is bitter, earthy, woody, dark fruits, tangy, Eccles cake, alcohol boost,treacle and brown sugar with sweet dark fruits on the finish. Medium body, fine carbonation and oily mouth-feel. Decent for the style.
Bottle at CWC II; dark brown pour with a thin light tan head, aroma has sweet jammy fruits, taste has sweet toffee, a hint of nuts, quite boozy.

Cotteridge Convention II. Bottle shared thanks to the guys at Cotteridge wines, cheers Kal and Jaz. Ruby red beer. Aroma of red fruit and sweet jam. Taste is jammy, sugar, sweet fruits, malts and some booze. Decent.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared at the Cotteridge Convention - 2016 edition. Cheers! Pours hazy amber with a creamy topping. Muted aroma, with just touches of dried fruits. Heavy sweet flavour with gooey sugars, bread, caramel, alcohol and light peat. Medium to full bodied with fine carbonation. Lightly warming on the finish, with notes of wood and toasted caramel. Pretty nice.
Tried at Cotteridge, 2. Deep ruby colour with an off tan head. Sweet fruity aroma, malty, with a light malty body.
Cotteridge 2 tasting. Dark brown beer lasting beige head. Malty ok sweet but some dryness. Over carbonated. Not too bad. Some demerara sugar. OK .

Bottle, 341mL. Home. A brown opaque beer with orange hues ; small white head ; no retention. Landscape : quince jam, grape, fig, roast, alcohol, sugar, pinot, caramel, light honey. Medium to heavy sweet ; round warming ; 1-dimensional. Full body, thin oily texture, soft carbonation, medium fruity toffee finish. Overall, OK strong warming fruity beer ; hard to drink cold ; better when temperature gets higher.

341 bottle. In the cellar for two years. Pour clear, and the colour of orange pekoe tea with a thin tan head. VERY boozy on the nose with raisin, lots of caramel, and candied fruit...its all there to prepare you for the sweetness I suppose; and yes, there is sweetness aplenty. Almost sticky dried fruit up front with alcohol and not much else that leads into some dark bread like malt notes with light earthiness, and a carmel heavy taste in a finish that Ive really only ever tasted in barley wine before now. In fact, now that I mention it, this kind of comes across as a barley wine with heavier dried fruit notes. Its not bad, but it sure aint complex.

Clear chestnut beer under a small, slightly yellowish head. Sweet, chestnuts, alcohol, fusels, leafy (dryish autumn leaves). Unbelievably sweet at first, syrupy, but again with this nutty, bitterish-leafy rounding. Alcohol (what did you expect?) dominating it all. Syrupy feel, sticky, utterly heavy bodied. Convincing to style, even if they managed to make it more sweet than the Germans would have done.

Bottle. Med deep red, brownish hue, clear. Malty. Some sweet nuttyness, ripe fruityness, malty strong lager charactery nose. Med full bodied, malty sweets, good bitters, soft smooth. Malty, slight herbals from the hops. Some earthyness. Not much, but some abv pushing through. Quite a nice robust intensive malty lager drink.Quite nice, could do another bottle easy.

341ml bottle from Saveur-Biere


Clear ruby red colour with a small head. Strong, malty and mellow with spices and some dark fruits. Good nightcap.

Courtesy of Jaghana. Only my 2nd eisbock
Couleur ambrée sombre, mousse qui disparait. Nez puissant de caramel légèrement brulé et malt dorge. Gout malt dorge, caramel legement cuit, note dalcool et sucre avec note fruits noirs. Corps un peu huileux. Fin caramel et fruits noirs cuits. Nickel comme bière.

La nouvelle image fait du bien à la bouteille mais le produit, quant à lui, est très "flat", autant aux yeux quen bouche. Trop dalcool en finale mais somme tout très respectable. Jaurais pu facilement confondre avec un genre de scotch ale bien houblonne...

Bouteille de 341ml au Marché des Brasseurs. Brune avec une mince et fugace mousse beige. Odeur de caramel, réglisse, cérales, avec pointes dalcool en arrière plan. Avec toutes ces arômes sucrées, je mattendais à un liquide sirupeux, mais non, cest presque aqueux. Sucrée, presque ad nauseam, elle passe très vite en bouche ne laissant quune mince trace damertume houblonneuse et des vapeurs dalcool pour rappeler son passage. Une bière à boire tempérée, au bond du feu après une longue journée dhiver.

Bottle 341ml kindly shared by Dominique. A clear cloudy amber beer with low head. Nose is on caramel, toffee, barley sugar, bit grainy. Aroma is on caramel, honey, red fruits, hop resin. Finish is on caramel, good bitterness duration on aftertaste with still caramel notes.

de assez fonce cette biere de glace en passant elle a changer son image et je la trouve mieux plus actuel je trouve on na plusieur assex corser le caramel suivi des fruit lui donne un caracteres agreable a boire

341ml bottle poured into a snifter around 10 degrees. Pours a deep copper robe with rich fiery highlights topped by about a finger of tanned roughly structured head. Carbonation is medium-sized and easy noticeable. Retention is average and lacing is timid. The nose is warm of toasted cereal, toffee, vanilla, liquor (brandy) with some alcohol backbone. On the tongue, you get a rich and dense caramelized malt with toasted nuts paired with a smooth liquorish brandy-like body. The finish is warm and pleasant with still, a good alcohol presence all the way to the end. Perfect beer for a cold winter day after a long walk or to go with a slice of your favorite fruit cake.

Bottle bought by Gf and daughters A: caramel, licorice, herbacy, red fruits App: clear reddish/brown no head t/p: full body with sweet and medium finish. Soft carbonation. O: OK. Would have expected something heavier/ stickier.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2016 Bouteille sans date. Robe brune-ambrée légèrement voilée avec un mince filet de mousse. Arômes de malt caramélisé, sucre dorge, baies confites, eau dérable, épices à biscuit. Nez agréable mais qui manque franchement de complexité et dintensité pour ce type de bière. En bouche, sucre dorge, malt caramelisé, pain à lérable, noisettes, dattes. Texture légèrement sirupeuse et corps rond. Manque un peu de complexité pour atteindre le niveau des grosses pointures du genre ainsi quune sensation au palais plus relevée.

Pours Jurrasic Park amber with virtually no head/retention. Nose is caramel, roasted grain, alcohol, molasses. Taste is caramel and molasses, ripe prunes/stone fruit, spice, some alcohol. Mouthfeel is heavy, syrupy, as it should be. Good interpretation of the style.

Bottle. Poured a deeper amberish color with an off white head. Nutty, some fruitiness, caramel, and some sugary sweetness. Alcohol content well hidden. Found it funny that Damico was drinking this exact beer at almost the exact same time even though we were 100s of miles apart.

Pours unclear dark crimson amber with a small beige ring. Aroma brings a balanced sweet malt flavor, a bit of fruity candi and currants but not too sweet at all. The flavor has a nice sweetness balanced as welll with the fruity eisbock flavors described in the nose.

Bottle @ home shared with Dutchdrebus and Ansjelaah. Clear amber reddish color, small beige head. Faint aroma, only get a slight maltyness and some sweetness. Taste lightly malts, sweetness, some alcohol, overripe fruits. Medium to full body, medium carbonation. Quite nice.

Bottle @ benzai. Clear amber colour with a very small sized off-white head. Smells sweet, barley wine, malts. Tastes sweet, barley wine, nuts, bourbon. I like the barley wine taste, so this beer?s fine for me. I?m not too familiar with eisbocks, so I don?t know whether this is a good one. I like the taste though. Medium to full body, soft carbo, slightly thick.

Nutty cereals aroma, plum ,honey. Rich caramel malt flavor, plenty of plum, dark cherry, biscuit, cocoa butter, funky sour finish. A quite enjoyable brew, pretty smooth despite the high abv thanks to a nice mix of sweet and fruity flavors.

Not that Ive had many but this isnt among the better eisbocks Ive enjoyed. Pours reddish brown without much head or lacing. Seems a little low in alcohol for style - tastes more like an average barley wine than an eisbock. Smells huge on caramelized malt. Pretty thick consistency as well. Finishes sweet with a note of woody barrel. Bottle.

BOTTLE 341ML shared with Boystout - thanks!

Look: clear dark ruby with a small disappearing head.
Aroma: super intense malt character, caramel, burnt sugar, dried prunes, raisins, some phenolic pepper, but not alcohol.
Taste: lighter than the aroma suggests but still rich, very sweet, malt, light phenolic, not much alcohol.
Rötlichbraunes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr malzig süß, fruchtig, alkoholisch. Geschmack sehr süß, malzig fruchtig, den Alkohol merkt man deutlich.

Couleur ambrée avec un col moyen et résistant. Nez de fruits rouge et de sucre. En bouche cest moyennement complexe Fruits rouges, sucre, caramel une petite touche de chocolat. Cest bien balancé, un peu trop sucré mais ce bois très bien!
Mahogany color, the taste of alcohol is présent.Un port, flavors of red fruit, well syrupy. The foam remains low and carbonation is very light. Almost a Barley Wine.

(bottle) clear medium amber colour with a small tan head; aromas of candied fruit; balanced flavour, surprisingly not very sweet, bit of acid well balancing the sweetness and also a bit of light bitter finish

Bottle. Pours a thin muddy brown with slight reddish hue, minimal head. Aroma has sticky sweet malt with heavy tootsie roll notes. Malty as all hell, almost like melted liquid malt extract, with tootsie roll. Slight alcohol presence, sticky sweet but thin body. Expected more depth, but the sticky malt extract feel covers everything.

Évaluation no.25. Août 2010.
Brune, foncée, mousse moyenne, persistance moyenne.
Nez malté de chocolat et de mélasse.
En bouche, les sucres sont bien balancés malgré la forte teneur en alcool. Le malt est très présent avec des notes de chocolat et de mélasse. Fumée en attaque. Très alcoolisée.

Bière brune-cuivrée, limpide et peu mousseuse. Le nez vascille entre le sucre cuit, la mélasse et lalcool. En bouche, du caramel salé simpose avant de sévanouir au profil dun degré dalcool cavalier. Lune des belles réussites de lalchimiste, à faire vieillir sans gêne au cellier.

Belle couleur acajou, avec un collet fort mince qui disparait très vite. Nez de raisins secs, de prunes confites, de vin de madère, de sucre dorge en arrière-plan. En bouche, cest liquoreux et légèrement pétillant. Le goût de vin de madère est présent. Les petits fruits confits se mêlent agréablement au goût bien balancé de caramel. Un style de bière que je nai pas goûté souvent, mais cela me semble très bien réussi. Lalcool est bien caché et les arômes puissants. Bonne petite bière de glace! Cheers!

(Draught at Little Delirium Café, Brussels, 26 Oct 2013) Dark brown colour with frothy, off-white head. Malty, roasted nose with dark bread, toast, ryvita and prunes. Malty, roasted taste with notes of toast, dark bread, coffee, prunes and a certain acidity in the finish. More than medium body, with a certain sweetness. Low bitterness. Quite tasty, but the shape of this was a bit questionable. Will try to rerate if possible. Quite enjoyable though.

Single at the local IGA in Gatineau, QC. Pours a clean deep amber colour with a fizzy beige head that does stop fizzing halfway, and stays a little longer than expected. Big sweet brown sugar aromas with notes of molasses, nuts, spices, fruity and caramel malts. Very well-hidden alcohol in the mouth, with just a little warming. The taste is not as good as the nose though. There seems to be a mild fight between the malty character and some light bitterness in the finish, which is kind of vegetable-like with some anise. The overall taste is kind of watered-down. Decent Eisbock, but wish it would taste as good as it smells.

Rouge foncée, mousse presque inexistante. Nez sucré, de fruits confits et dalcool. Doux en bouche, sucré au goût, encore les fruits confits et lalcool, mais moins présent quau nez, une petite touche de réglisse fait apparition à la fin.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2016 Bière brune assez foncée aux reflets rubis, moyennement voilée avec particules en suspension pouvant être assez grosses, effervescence moyenne, et surmontée dà peine une trace blanchâtre en guise de col. Arômes de pain grillé, pâtisserie et grain rôti, avec tout de même beaucoup de sucres foncés, cassonade, caramel (à tendance brûlé même par moment!) et tire dérable. Effluve également assez alcoolisé et minéral (salé), fumée, tendance charcuterie Odeurs aussi un peu fruité (raisin, prune), et un peu épicé (clou de girofle, piment de la Jamaïque, anis). Nez intéressant et agréable, complexité et intensité adéquates. En bouche, pétillement tout de même assez élevé sur la langue, et onctuosité également bien élevée au palais, le breuvage est rond, moelleux, soyeux et velouté! Au goût, pain grillé, pâtisserie et grain rôti, avec un abondant sucré, beaucoup de caramel et dérable à bonne tendance «collant«, épais, tire Saveur également un peu fumée, tendance charcuterie, petit salé, subtils tourbe, terre, feuille morte Goût aussi un peu fruité, fruits foncés bien mûrs voire confits, raisin, prune, pruneau, figue Finale à lamertume minimale voire inexistante, aucun goût réellement houblonné (à part peut-être une subtile trame de fond herbacé), cette bière est tout en malt et tout de même passablement sucrée, mais personnellement, jaime beaucoup ça. Complexité et intensité en bouche bien élevées. Très bonne bière! /// Jai déjà bu une bouteille vieillie plus de trois ans pour une explosion maltée des plus satisfaisante! Jy avais noté des saveurs céréalières accrue et éventail sucré plus élargi (mélasse, sucre dorge). Très bonne candidate au vieillissement!

341 ml bottle.
Pours clear ruby red color with a minimal head. Aroma of sweet malts, caramel, dark ripe fruits, dark berries and some syrupy notes. Flavour of sweet caramel malts, dark ripe fruits and berries with somewhat sweet syrupy finish. Feels a bit thin, very good slow sipper anyway.
5316

34,1 cl bottle @ home
Aroma is sweet and malty withcaramel, lots of toffee, woody and grainy notes. Also some hay Ive observed in some german bocks. Flavour is sweet with caramel, toffee, woody notes and hay. A certain English feeling here. In the finish sweetness is balanced with alcohol, unfortunately also some gluey notes occur. Starts to warm my throat after some sips. Good, but not excellent.

Tap at Little Delirium. My Eisbock tick. Yippee! Golden brown/dark amber colour, small thin off-white head. Aroma is oud bruin sour, earthy, not as I expected, lightly fruity, apples, and quite sweet. Something a bit skunky too. Taste is pretty unusual. Initial sourness, but then quite a bit of sweetness. Really reminiscent of an oud bruin again. Aftertaste is bit vegetal though. One is definitely enough in one sitting. Little bit of spritziness.

Tap at Little Delirium. Deep amner-orange, clear, medium-sized fine head. Rich malt nose, caramel, treacle. Sweet, fruity flavors of orange, caramel, raisin, fig. Very drinkable and likeable, though a bit simple. Hides alcohol well.

Pours a clear red with no head and no lacing. Aroma is caramel, grass and alcohol. Taste is sweet with a bit of bitterness and alcohol heat. Flavor is rich with caramel, booze and a small fruit. Mouthfeel is sticky a little, or maybe a little oily. It even feels a little watery at time. Not bad but nothing is sticking out and it is not really complex so not great either.

TAP at Delirium cafe Brussels. Shared with Mathieu87. 
APPEARANCE: dark blond beer, small stable off white head.
NOSE: hoppy, sweetness, little spices.
TASTE: rather sweet, little hoppy, somewhat watery.

Bouteille de 2011. Breuvage épais couleur caramel qui prend une teinte rouge à la lumière. Relents de butterscotch et de sucre cuit (on redoute un mauvais vieillissement). En bouche, les craintes senvolent en grande partie : le caramel succède aux fruits confits, lalcool est perceptible mais pas trop, la madérisation ne brouille finalement pas les cartes. Cependant, et si cest lun des produits-phare de la brasserie de Joliette, elle demeure un peu ordinaire, sans artifices. Tout de même très bonne, et belle entrée en matière pour les néophytes du style "bière de glace".
(341ml bottle)  Pours a dark brown body with a small brown head.  Aroma of caramel, toffee, pulm, chocolate, and raisins.  Flavor of caramel, chocolate, roasted malt, and toffee.

À loeil :
Une teinte rougeâtre et une translucidité faible. Pas de mousse, pas deffervescence : le calme plat !
Au nez : 
Un peu de céréale, de bois, de cuir, si on travaille fort. La Eisbock se cache..
Au goût :
Cest fumé et sucré à la fois, semblable à la mélasse. Une légère amertume ferme la marche. Les saveurs sont intenses et persistent à chaque gorgée ! Le corps est gras et rond. À boire tranquillement ;)
clear but red colour. resinous hoppy notes. that i find strange for this beer. malted and maple or smoked aroma. i find this strange. sweet and bitter notes, hops and medium bodied brew. it is okay.
Bright brick coloured pour with a short, tan head. Lots of grain on the nose with sugar and dry dogfood and something else...maple? Lots of dark sweet flavours. Kind of sticky.

Draft @ Delrium Tap House. Dark textbook amber with a reddish hue, stable off-white film for a head. Smells very sweet, German very thick caramel malts, thick sugar, syrupy, maple, nuts, thick German styled stuff. Taste is lots & lots of the syrupy thick German caramel malts goo, maple, brown sugar, brown bananas, sweet herbal, thick brown sugar, caramel, light roast, some herbal bitterness in the back & noticeable ABV, syrupy alcohol. Thick, German body. Very clearly an Eisbock, well-done, only a bit hard to finish a glass of but certainly fits the bill. 25 cl.

Draft @ Delirium Taphouse, Brussels.
AMbrée, col épais beige.
Arôme est bien malté, note rappelant le crystal malt, caramel à souhait laissant qcq effluves sucrées alternant entre pomme caramélisée ou sucre brun.
Palais présente une effervescence agréable en harmonie avec le profil de cette bière. Malt léger, grillé, caramel sucré avec un alcool réchauffant qui simmisce discrètement en fin de bouche. Le tout devient un peu collant aux lèvres sur un fruité noir très léger dont seul les sucres servent comme indice. Appréciable aussi le côté caramel tirant sur le toffee/chocolaté qui est accentué par une présence discrète de houblon herbacé en amérisant. 
AU final se caramélisé arrive à la limite dune Steinbock allemande, pas mal, et à boire à laise.

Bonne tite biere. Le procédé de fabrication est interressant et donne un certain gout unique lié a son fort pourcentage dalcool. Par contre, il ne faut pas sattendre a une explosion de saveur. On sen tien a une genre de "bock" sucré, forte en alcool. Bonne tite biere dapres-midi dété.

Bouteille 341ml. Couleur acajou tirant sur le rouge, légère mousse beige laissant un anneau. Arôme de caramel, fruits confits, malt, prune, alcool, sauce soya? Goût de malt rôti, caramel, alcool, légère amertume. Carbonation faible, corps moyen-dense, huileuse.

341 ml. Brune pas très foncé et brumeuse. Mince broue beige. Odeur et gout de whisky, caramel et d'alcool, avec une fin houblonneuse intéressante. La rondeur en bouche est bien aussi.
Je n'aime pas les bières qui goutent le whisky, mais elle me semble bien balancée.

Bottle via a trade. Pours with a clear brown hued body with a small tan head. Aromas almost have a bit of bourbon in them. Some high ABV nasal burn, maple, marzipan, melanoidins, brown sugar, nutty, lightly raisinated. Flavors are boozy, bitter and sweet, slightly faded. Caramel, melanoidins, boozy, thick and syrupy with a sweet finish.

Bottle poured a clear reddish amber with a small lingering amber head. Aromas of carmel, prune, plum, earthiness and nuyts. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of carmel, earthiness, prune and light nuts with a smooth lingering carmel finish.

341ml bottle. A clear dark ruby body, minimal beige head. Aroma of caramel, roasted nuts, toffee, floral, booze. Taste of caramel, roasted malt, chocolate, booze, floral hops, wood barrel. Full body, oily, soft carbonation.

341mL Bottle - purchased at Depanneur Peluso - Montreal, QC. 2012. Nutty, slightly oxidized and almost hoppy aroma. Maybe Im just confusing the overall oxidation with oxidized hops. Must be that twist of cap. I have to ask though, how can a beer made this year be so noticely oxidized and old tasting? Im assuming it must be bulk aged. Oxidation can be occasionally endearing in a Barleywine or an Imperial Sout, but in this Eisbock, its just sad and wet cardboard. All that lovely malt development and crispness is handily defeated by tangy, dusty, faded oxygen-infused beer. Its kind of at a tipping point though, a few more months and this will be completely shot. Now the front end displays a brief whimper of caramels, toasted sugars, and brandy. I would like to know what this is like without oxidation.

Bottle 341 ml. Bought at Peluso (Montreal). Served in Snifter. POurs dark red. Beige head is quickly diminishing. Aroma: strong notes of alcohol, malt and bananas. Taste: alcohol, roasted malt, caramel. May lacks a little balance. Alcohol is not so well hidden (well, it is a 9.5% abv after all). Intense warming alcohol. This full bodied beer has an extremely dry finish. Heavy beer. A very complex and interesting beer by lAlchimiste.
Surprenant!  Une brasserie poid plume qui se bat en haut de sa catégorie et sen tire honorablement.  Chaud, caramel, enveloppe la bouche.  Cest pas Aventinus mais cest pas mal.
Bottle. Pours an amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy caramel aroma. Sweetish malty fruity caramel flavor. Has a sweetish malty spicy caramel finish.
Bouteille 341 mL. Edition 2010. Nez d'erable et de caramel. Bouche rappelant l'eau d'erable avec une finale un peu mince.

34.1 cL bottle. Pours clear and golden orange with a small white head. Aroma is cornish and dry dark roasted malty. Sweet cornish, malty and caramelish. Light grassy touch. Caramelish and roasted malty finish.

12 oz Bottle-Trade w/AleHunter-Clear copper pour w/almost no head. Malt aroma. Some malt flavor, some bread dough, yeast, caramel. Smooth & easy to drink, alcohol was well hidden. Not a great brew, but Id drink it again, probably better on tap. Completed my final style....again, as my previous Eisbock (Schneider Aventinus) got reclassified!

pours a relatively clear medium dark brown with a small beige head, some retention. loads of caramel malts, some roastiness, fruity. figs, raisins. leafy green hops - decent grassy finish. medium body - oily mouthfeel.

Bottle 341 ml. Pours amber with a quickly diminishing off-white head. Aroma: Caramel, malt, alcohol, herbal. Taste: Harsh. Malt, caramel, strong notes of alcohol. Dry finish. Alcohol warming. Overall: Lack complexity. Very harsh but should be better with aging. Give this beer the time to mellow.

Bottle. 341ml.
Pours amber, with a low off-white head, quickly vanishing. Aroma is of sugar, malt, alchool and some hops. Taste is sweet, contains alot of burnt malt and some slight bitterness in the end. Warming alchool. Well balanced, and full bodied. A good beer.
341ml bottle sharedby jsprime. light brown small off white head. big malty aroma. nice sweet sipper. true to style. nice one.

Liquide ambré couronné dune belle mousse dense et persistante, laissant une dentelle inégale. Odeurs de malt, de caramel, de miel et dherbes fraîches qui sont assez volatiles. Goût sucré laissant une belle amertume en arrière-goût, emportant avec elle un fumet et une saveur dalcool, plutôt agréable, malgré le pourcentage dalcool. Correcte. (158-310112)

341 ml bottle. Pours a nice amber ruby red. White head with very low retention. Smells of grains and herb. Good malty caramel taste with hints of fruits. Alcohol is present, as should be expected. Nice dry finish. Strong body, medium to low carbonation. Good one!

12oz bottle. Nice mahogany with a quickly fading tan head. Alcohol, raisin, caramel, malt. Very hot and prickly, moderate carbonation, alcohol overwhelms a lot, moderate body apart from the booze, sweet with a nice hoppy undertone, becomes dry and bitter at the end. This one definitely seems like it needs a bit of time to settle and mellow out.

Date: July 30, 2010
Mode: Bottle
Source: Tasting, Cellar Party
Appearance: clear dark brown, scant head
Aroma: sweet caramel aroma, candy sweetness, touch of fruityness
Flavor: sweet caramel flavor, dry earthyness, light bitterness
Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 13/20
Rating: 3.2/5.0Drinkability: 8/10
Score: **+ /4

Au nez cest assez discret comparativement à ce que la première gorgée apporte. Grosse note de cassonade, caramel, pomme verte et fruits confits dans un corps plein et grossier. Pas très élégant mais assez bien réussi tout de même.

341ml bottle. About 2 years old.
Appearance : Deep clear amber with no head.

Aroma : Rich peachy fruits with some raisins.quite sweet.

Taste : Sweet raisins and dried peaches. Some wood with alcohol. Plums and other dark sweet fruits. Lots of raisins on finish.

Overall : Big, sweet, alcoholic. I was afraid it was going to be worse than this though. Decent fruity profile with decent malty sweetness. Theres however no elegance there, its just massive sweet raisins but not much else.

Appearance: Pours an amber-brown body, good clarity, with no apparent head formation.

Smell: A simple, lightly scented trace of bready, caramelly malts, then, a bit of fruitiness and sniff of booze. Its just not particularly inviting or appealing. You just want to quietly, carefully pour it back into the bottle and dismiss it as you push it aside with your hand, moving on to something else. But, weve come this far, lets press on!

Taste: Well, huh, theres oddly very little flavor for a purported eisbock, though its no surprise after the underperforming aroma. A touch of toast, very mild, with faint hints of herbs, apricots, and tangelos. Drying, warm finish. Youre in and out in a flash, as theres not much going on in there.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Nil carbonation.

Overall: Unlike any eisbock Ive previously encountered, in that its totally lacking all the rich, complex maltiness and potent, pleasing flavors one would expect and hope for. If this is the concentrated, post-freezing results, Id be curious to see what the heck they started with.

Excellent malty eisbock with lots a strong caramel and burnt malt taste. Very true to the style, tastes like some of the eisbocks I used to buy in Germany, something I dont often say about many of the German style beers I try here in Quebec. I am quite impressed.
Small (size and duration) head.  Nice brown color. Lots of life in the mouth.  Very nice.

Jolie bière limpide couleur dacajou coiffée dun fin col crème laissant une mince dentelle au verre.  Des arômes de chocolat noir, de céréales grillées et de vanille.  moyennement amère avec une trace de sucre.  Réconfortante et ronde, elle est de texture crémeuse.  Elle laisse une douce fin arômatique en bouche.

Bottle.  Pours a bruin body with an off white head.  Sweet malty body with toffee, caramel and some light fruit tones.   Big apple and apricot sweetness, a hint of spice.  Sweet vinous warmth and a nice chewy body.  Soft carbonation and a light fruit sweetness.  Nice offering.

On tap at Saint Bock. Pours a deep brown color with a tiny brown head. The aroma is sweet malts, some heat, caramel. The flavor is a warm  sweet Eisbock; caramel and sweet toasted malts, some fruit. Decent.
Pours a rich amber red color with no head.  Aroma is fruity, caramel, toast, roast, and some earthy hops.  Flavor is caramel, toast, some roast, and a bitter roasty finish.
Bouteille 341 ml. 9.5%. Couleur brun foncé, claire, mousse beige fugasse. Nez de caramel malté et fruit. Goût de caramel, de fruits, assez complexe. Finale sans amertume, notes dalcool.

À lil, la couleur du liquide oscille entre le brun et le bourgogne.  Absence de mousse.  Le nez est sollicité par des parfums de gâteau aux fruits et aux noix, de toffee, dalcool et par la nette apparition de cerises gorgées de sucre.  En bouche, le liquide épais et liquoreux donne des saveurs qui sont collées aux arômes.  Sur la langue et sous le palais, le liquide ne développe pratiquement aucune bulle.  En finale, lalcool se manifeste sans effet brûlant.  Conclusion : bonne doppelbock aux stéroïdes.

Bottled, thanks Timo A! Slightly hazy deep ruby color. Sweet and tart aroma with raisins, red currants, toffee, nuts and hint of glue. Toffeish, bready and nutty flavor with raisins and raspberry. Thick body. Tastes slightly stale, but there are some nice vinous notes.

Bottle from a trip to Montreal back in April, with the hope that by putting some more age on it I wont get a big hot mess.  Pours a deep black to brown, a bit of haze, and a touch of a thin tan head.  As I was expecting this to be a bit boozy, I was happily surprised when greeted with a large amount of dark plums, chocolate pudding.  The flavor follows the nose with loads of soft chocolate and light malty caramel.  Viscous and smooth, very faint carbonation.  Somewhat reminiscent of a candy bar.  Very faint warming alcohol notes develop after the finish, and aside from that, no real hints that this is 9.5%.  A very pleasant surprise here.

Deep mahogany, very thin tan head, little lacing.
Aroma is quite malty, lots of dark fruits, caramel, toffee, light alcohol, some gingerbread.
Flavour is of dark fruits, toffee sweetness, malty, cake, light alcohol.
Sweet mouthfeel, medium body, medium carbonation.
Finishes long, sweet, malty, warming. 
Surprisingly good. Aged very well. Very malty and the alcohol is almost non existant. 
341ml bottle purchased from La Trappe a Fromage in Gatineau, Quebec.
Opened on March 14, 2009.
Purchased early 2008.

Bottle. Chocolate, molassis, tobacco an cookie aroma. Claret haze, low brown head. Molassis, caramel, roasted/burned notes heading towards toasted wood and tobacco, berry notes. Coffee, chocolate and bunrned caramel retronasal. Medium body, sticky mouthfeel.

Acheté au jovi et dégusté dans un verre tulipe de dieu du ciel. De couleur cuivré foncé avec un mince collet de mousse et une belle effervescence. Olfactivement elle présente des odeurs de caramel, mélasse, prune et raisin sec. Liquoreuse en bouche, sucre à la crême, dates et figues. Un bon goût dalcool et de crême soda. Un peu trop gazéfier mais quand même intéressante.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2009 I think this Eisbock is a première in Québec, bottled...  So it is my first Eisbock.  I got no references for this kind of beer.  I first thought it was a brown belgium type beer especially because the very sweet taste reminded me of the brown 2008 unaged Kasteel.  Seems it is german...  O.K...  Dominant chocolaty caramel in the taste, with fruits and herbal subtilities.  I am liking this more and more.  Garde ton audace, Alchimiste et merci de distribuer dans les IGA.  ADDED: Aging was a bad idea.  It turned sour.

Draught a la Ninkasi et en bouteille aussi.
Biere d un brun tres foncer, avec reflets roux lorsque regarder a la lumiere. gouts de raisins secs et de pruno deshydrater, de dattes, de caramel bruler et de toffee. Sirupeuse, cremeuse. Sensation rechauffante provenant de l acool. Delicieuse. er quelques unes.

Draught at the Ninkasi and in bottles too. Dark brown beer with reddish highlights. Rasins, prunes, dates, burnt caramel and toffee. Syrupy, creamy. Alcohol warming sensation. Very good. I m aging a couple of these.

330. Thanks, Glouglouburp! Whoo, something went bad wrong here. Nearly black mahogany with caramel highlights at the corners. Dense, moussy tan head. Big sharp overripe rotten fruit nose, riding a wave of sharp boozy notes. Creamy medium body, really gooey and sticky and syrupy. Maybe the densest beer I have had. Tangy overripe fruit again, lots of hot alcohol twang. QA problems and way out of balance anyway...too bad, because the extremity of the recipe would have been interesting to taste if they had dialed it and then brewed it clean before bottling.

A dark clear brown ale with a thin off white head. An aroma of burned caramel, fusel alcohol, and mashed peas, a bit unpleasant. In mouth, sweet candy sugar, astringent notes, a bit of boiled vegetables. More or less good.  Tasted early April 2007.

12oz guessing a bonus from Dany Glougoburp.  Damn this took me a while to find in the database.  Pours dark brown with a 1 finger head faded from a 2 finger tan head.  Nose is super malty.  Taste is sweet and kind of insipid, too much alc in the taste for a beer under 10%.  not my thing.

They have changed the label on this.  Told to serve at 50 degrees plus (what happened to Celsius?).  Pours a dark thicker looking brown.  The taste is above average mouthfeel, above average carbonation and a good chocolate and malting job.  The alcohol is there though not extreme. Some raisin, anise is good.  Though I got this fresh from Metro Joanette, it has a few months bottling on it and sweetness is not too much.  Refreshing and satisfying.

341ml bottle. 
Dark mahoghany pour, next to no head. Aroma of ripe fruit, port, grapes, and sweet malt. Flavour is quite malty, with a touch of chocolate, and some raisins. A nice beer for the style, not too overly sweet, well balanced, and a good maltiness. I really enjoyed this, it drank very well for a 9% beer.

341ml bottle from Trappe a Fromage, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass.
App.:  Very deep mahogany, clear, orange-tan head that dissipates fairly quickly.
  
Aroma:  Extremely fruity  huge mounds of raisins, figs and dates, some blueberries and other field berries, big, sticky molasses and brown sugar, very chewy and sweet (if an aroma can be chewy...), a bit like cola with some minty herbals, a touch nutty; this is a big beer.
  
Palate:  Medium-full body, fairly soft carbonation.
  
Flav.:  More field berry than dried fruit, but both are present, extremely sweet, Welchs grape jelly, some herbal rootbeer and cola note, a bit of darker malt (chocolate-ish); finishes sweet (but not quite cloying), with a little bit of alcohol (not enough!) and a pleasant small fruit aftertaste. 

A sipper for sure, not sure how much of this I could drink at one time.

(Dégusté avec french tickler) Biere rouge-vin tres foncé. Odeur de framboises, mures, fruits des champs, melasse, bleuets, chocolat amer, jus de raisins ett de sucre. Complxité asser avancé. Gout de chocolat, petit coté crémeux, sucré, cerises noire, diffinitivement un trait de tarte au sucre. Une biere tres impressionante!!

Shared with Pyrozoid.  Poors a very dark red/amber with little head.  Aromas of molasses, grape juice, blueberries, blackberries, bitter chocolate, butter, prunes... Slightly overcarbonated yet it has a very nice sweet medium bodied mouthfeel.  Dry bitter finish.  Flavors are somewhat creamy and dark fruits.  No imminent detection of alcohol yet as it warms it becomes more present.  Overall very impressed by this Alchimiste brew.
On tap @ Vices et Versa, Montreal. Deep black opaque pour. Medium bodied, roasted malt flavor along with some anise & licorice. sweet tasting also. Dcent beer alcohol well hidden

Bouteille de 341 ml. La bière possède une couleur rouge vin avec des reflets marrons. La mousse quand à elle est abondante au début mais elle laisse rapidement place à un cercle en dentelle. Au nez des arômes de raisins, de prunes, de pommes rouges, de fruits des champs, de caramel, de beurre et de sucre se présente à mes sinus. En bouche la bière est ronde, moelleuse et sirupeuse. Les flaveurs sont semblables à ceux du nez mais il y a aussi le chocolat et lalcool qui sonti présents. À noter que en fût la bière a un léger goût madérisé.

Thick, chewy and sweet malt profile with fresh tobacco, and plum, berry and raisin fruity esters in the nose.  Hazy, dark amber-brown coloured body is topped by a decent, fine bubbled, fizzy, tan head that recedes quite rapidly to a thin partial cover with no lace.  Plenty of fruity flavours in the mouth but although it is quite sweet, it doesnt seem all that malty.  Fair bitterness keeps it from cloying.  Very strong prickly carbonation to the medium-dry body.  I have to say that I really like the name though!  Tulip glass.  Just above fridge temperature.  Bottle (Le Gobelet, Jan-08).

Bouteille brune de 341 ml, brassin de 2008 à 9,5 % dalcool. Arômes de fruits rouges (framboise) et dalcool. Robe rousse et foncée. Goût de caramel et de fruits rouges. Lalcool est très présent et donne un côté sirupeux à la bière. Arrière-goût bref de fruits mûrs et dalcool.

341ml brown bottle

now called only eisbock

A: dark reddish brown, almost no head at all
S: stong malt nose, caramel, toffee, butter, diacetyl, 
T: strong malty, suguray, taste, alcool, 
M: strong beer, 
D: one is enough, strong but still drinkable,

Bottle: Poured a clear deep brown color bock with a huge foamy head with good retention but no lacing. Aroma of sweet malt with too much sugar for my own taste. Taste is dominated by cardboard notes (oxidized) with some over the top sweet. I could also detect some dry fruits notes which I am sure would have been great had they not been dominated by the cardboard and the sweetness.

Bouteille 341ml. De couleur brune rouge foncée et légèrement voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (dates, figues, léger de prunes, notes de raisins), malté de caramel toffee légèrement rôti et terreux, de biscuits, léger de pain et de houblon herbeux avec des petites notes de chocolat. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement bas et une texture légèrement sirupeuse. Goût de levures fruitées (figues, dates, notes de prunes et de raisins aux notes vineuses) accompagné de petites notes fumées lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût malté de caramel toffee moyennement terreux et légèrement rôti ainsi quun goût de biscuits, des notes de pain et de chocolat puis en finale lon retrouve un goût moyennement amer de houblon herbeux ainsi que des notes de levures épicées (poivre) et dalcool très doux. Post-goût long et un peu sec, moyennement amer de rôti, de houblon herbeux avec un léger goût fruité (figues, moût de raisins) et des notes dalcool.

341 ml bottle. Pours a brownish red with a large bubbly light beige head. Initial aroma is very sweet but then changes and an acidic vious quality takes over. Flavor is slightly acidic and bitter and nothing great.

Pours a clear ruby color with almost no head. Aroma of malt and candied fruits. Flavor of malt, blueberries, candied fruits, caramel and mild alcohol. The body is light to medium with a liquorous texture and soft carbonation. A bit thin and I miss the rich malt presence I get in good Eisbocks.

12oz bottle, probably 6 months old. Aroma is surprisingly malty, dry, hibiscus and unsweetened cocoa. Decent complexity. A bit of head on the pour. Taste is quite different, much sweeter, coriander, kind of weird tasting. Was better when it was cold. Pretty much worthless at room temperature. It actually has some yeast signature that I was getting in almost every Dieu de Ciel beer I sampled. Hmmmmm....

Brown bottle, 341 ml, Trappist tasting at my place, savoured on March 9 2007; eye: burgundy, no effervescence, clear, no head; nose: malt, smoke, alcohol, roasting; mouth: roasted malt, dry bitter hops, a bit of alcohol, pepper, finale in roasted malt with a nice bitterness, medium body, quite bitter, slightly sweet, slightly grainy texture, mildly carbonated

FRANÇAIS 

Bouteille brune, 341 ml, soirée Trappiste chez nous, savourée le 9 mars 2007; oeil : bourgogne, pas deffervescence, claire, pas de mousse; nez : malt, fumée, alcool, torréfaction; bouche : malt torréfié, houblon amérisant sec, un peu dalcool, poivre, finale en malt torréfié avec une belle amertume, corps moyen, assez amère, très légèrement sucrée, texture légèrement granuleuse, moyennement carbonatée

341 ml bottle from Métro Joannette, Verdun QC (May 2007) served at cellar temperature from a Maudite glass.  A largish, bubbly caramel-creme head fizzes away very quickly above the translucent rust-tinted maple body, leaving no lacing and just a tiny lasting ring of foam....caramel-chocolate dominates the aroma, soft touches of tart raspberries find their way in as well, faint sour/doughy yeast, not as expressive as it could be but whats there is nice.....soft body is, like the aroma, lightly tart and fruity which is surprising and probably stylistically suspect, but it doesnt detract from my enjoyment....this is an extremely easy-drinking, very "lagery" eisbock if you know what I mean, grainy and suggestive of the fields as much as of caramelized, sugary maltings....in the end it has something of the character of New Glarus Cherry Stout which is no slam coming from me -- something of that thick juicy maltiness with a nice fruity admixture -- though its not nearly as burnt/roasty as a stout....there is just no alcohol presence here whatsoever, Id guess 5.5-6% if I had to....tart, acidic finish; fairly high carbonation and light-bodied at the end.  A weird one, this, not sure what kind of eisbock this is, but on the whole its enjoyable whatever you want to call it.

Bottle (341ml).  Via trade with Viper666.  Poured cloudy burnished copper-red with a large, lasting, frothy beige head.  First impression of the aroma was "sour" but it shook out to caramel/chocolate malt, damp grain, dry, peppery yeast, and figs - the figs fooled me into thinking sour, this is just salty/tart fruit.  The taste is quite mild, with caramel grain up front and salty somewhat unripe figs in the finish.  Syrupy yet watery body, quite flat, mildly acidic, quick finish.  Nice, but it seems a little off-kilter.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2008 Clear dark-ruby body with a small beige head.  As expected this is malt galore.  Flavour of figs, dates, graham cookies, brown sugar, toffee and why not a few drops of brandy.  Very short finish.  Not too sweet considering the style and abv.  Alcohol is apparent but not overly so.  This is a filling strong beer that is surprisingly a bit light on taste.  Medium body and soft carbonation.  Too much alcohol too little taste.  Cleverly named after a congélateur (freezer) and the classic bock Celebrator.  The most witty product name since the Hand Job work gloves (no kidding, those exist).

Aroma:caramel,barley sugar,light cooked vegetable..
Appearance:dark ruby brown,light head..
Flavor:Caramel,alcohol,cooked vegetable,toffee....

Dark ruby brown color, with a beige head, but falling quickly, sweet toasted and caramelized malt nose, with a cocoa powder, chocolatey note, a fruity accent of raisins, dates, brown sugar, toffeeish hint, and a mild alcoholic aroma follows through on a full-bodied palate with a sweet roasted raw malt character, some caramel and toffeeish accents, hint of dark chocolate, with some fruity raisiny, plummy flavors, a  brown sugar note, leading towards a malty, alcoholic finish.

Considering the style, Scores ranging from 1 to 5, 5 being the most intense

Comments: A fun beer, a good malt monster by Quebec standards, but suffers a bit from the unavoidable comparison to the few other world-class examples.
Une noire.  Il faut aimer.  Beaucoup de mousse, un collet qui demeure.  Goût très prononcé de rôtie.

Bottle. Nice hazy ruby body topped with an average off-white foamy head. Good malty aroma with brown sugar notes. Alcohol is fairly well hidden. Its sweet and malty taste carries earthy and oaky hints. It ends with a bitter/sour finish. Without being an above-average Bock, this is a very drinkable beer.

Bouteille. Arôme légèrement fumé et alcool, et plus fort un équilibre torréfié-caramel. Belle couleur rouge-cuivre, translucide, mousse qui disparait très rapidement. Goût de caramel très présent, lamertume suit de près et ensuite lalcool. Arrière-goût dalcool et damertume. Effervescence moyenne à faible, corps moyen à capiteux. Pour le prix je suis très déçu...(4.25$ pour 341ml ! )

Bottle... Mostly clear ruby lager with a small, creamy, khaki head. Decent retention. Vinous, malty nose. The flavor is well-balanced, but unexciting. The alcohol is completely hidden somewhere within the glass. It feels like 9.4% ABV laying here by the pool, but doesnt at all taste like it. Unfortunately, the flavor is mostly nondescript... not unpleasant, but also not much of anything at all. Medium-bodied with lively carbonation. Tongue-numbing (local anesthetic-like), lightly bitter finish. Cheers to beerbuzzmontreal for shipping the bottle to Florida from the Great White North!

Bottle ( thanks Serge) 

Puts a dark chestnut brown lager in the chalice with ruby highlights. Hard pour puts a small 1 finger fine pored cap on the top..moderate lacing.

Aroma: Char, smoke, figs, cocoa and a wisp of fusil not overly pronounced.

Up front the big chewy cake like malts..gorgeous!!..like liquid Bundt..midpalate the wonderful Nobel variety hops show up to give that signature German herbal-woody balance to the malts...finish is long and wet...bready, chared astringency shows a bit, cocoa and woody hops..excellent finish. smooth and warming...alcohol hidden well in the profile. Decent drying in the after taste between the thick noble herbas and carred astringency of the patent malts. 

Well put together...tasteful, balanced, drinkable for a big beer but not over the top ans unbalanced like an extreme beer.

As eisbocks go this is very drinkable..not overly complex but has a character like a very mellow malty tripple bock with just enough herbal hopping to offset the big malts and keep sweetness out of the mix. 2 thumbs up!

Bottle. Pour a clear red body and a dying white head. Complex but soft aroma of chocolate, caramel and toasted bread. Medium carbonation no alcohol, caramel taste but not much sweetness. Bitternes is proheminent.   Some vegetable(red peppers) notes in the finish. Quite refreshing.
Bottle 341ml. Clear red/orange with a thin white head. Aroma is caramel, spices, bread and fruits. Flavor is caramel, hops, spices and bread.

Bouteille de 341 ml, avec un taux de 9.4%. Couleur bourgogne foncé, pas de collet. Arome de petits pois mais le malte caramelisé le suit de très près. Goût de malte caramelisé légèrement camoufflé par lalcool, un peu fruité mais un arrière goût sec.
Robe rouge très claire surmontée dune mince mousse blanche. Arômes légers de caramel. Saveurs de caramel, de houblon amérisant herbacé, dalcool, de fruits rouges et de pain.

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2007 First batch, at the brewpub in 2005, weighing in at 8.5%abv.:
The Lure:On filtered copper and orange highlights rests a minimal but clinging head. Candied earth hints, toasted malt, minute yeast and a subtle mineral character all get along, but too discreetly.

The Festivities:Served way too cold (3-4 degrees Celsius?). Considerable caramel malt and a healthy earthy flesh are well-welded to a fine toasted malt bitterness with the help of an alcohol nibble. Aftertaste is light, body is medium-sized, nothing overwhelms and nothing much is memorable.

Transcendence:Recluse and thoughtful can be a let down when seeking pleasure.

First ever bottled batch, now called Congelator, weighing in at 9.4%abv.:
I dont know if its me, but the dark burgundy gown on this one is darker than what I remembered it to be. The round maltiness is definitely its best feature, with fruity caramel and bready notes quietly building into love handles. A hushed dryness from the supporting hops is felt. The shy nose doesnt announce the rich maltiness to come, which is disappointing. Alcohol is well-hidden for its size; this remains an enjoyable sipper within its style. Funnily enough, points are exactly the same as those of the glass I had at the brewpub two years ago.

Verre de dégustation à la brasserie. Arôme: Odeur de caramel, de pamplemousse et dalcool. Apparence: Couleur ambrée foncée. Petit col beige pétillant qui perdure. Grosse dentelle. Saveur: Petite sensation de douceur au début et à la fin. Arrière goût court. Palette: Corps moyen. Texture deau. Faible carbonisation. Arrière goût dalcool. (Rating #61)
